name: Rumyana Neykova
bio: is a second year PhD student at Imperial College London, under the supervision of Prof. Nobuko Yoshida. She holds a bachelor in Computer Science from University of Sofia (2009), Bulgaria and a Master in Software engineering from Imperial College London (2011).  Her research interests are in the area of distributed systems and networks, as well as type systems and language design. Her Ph.D focuses on exploring the use of a distributed types theory (called session types) for runtime verification of concurrent and distributed systems.
